page.title: 20Transport.
page.content: The only practical means of transport to and from the Consett area is via the road network. Since the closure of the steelworks in the town, the proportion of households which boast a car has fallen considerably. A wide variety of car makes are bought in the area, though our school survey suggested that Ford is still the most popular. Four star petrol currently costs just under Â£2 per gall. Roads are continually being repaired in the area and the new Leadgate by-pass is nearing completion at a cost of approx. The lines finally closed in 1983 giving us miles of derelict lines Derwentside Council will tackle this.
